features.additionalInfo: You can use BPAY to quickly and easily pay your bills online.
You can set up direct debits.

PayTo is a service that's been developed by the NPPA (New Payments Platform Australia) that businesses, service providers and merchants can opt in to. Essentially, it's a digital way for customers to pre-authorise payments from their bank accounts in real time, for things like utilities, subscriptions and memberships.

You can establish yourself as a BPAY biller, giving your customers the convenience and flexibility to make payments 24/7. They can make payments online or over the phone. Faster payments mean you can reduce the time and cost associated with managing collection of payments. Separate fees are applicable for this service and your use will be subject to a separate agreement with us.
Access your money with a Bankwest Debit Card.

Have easy access to your money with a Business Debit Mastercard. It's available to Australian citizens and temporary or permanent residents over 16 with an Australian residential address (limited exceptions may apply subject to conditions).
You can access this account in Bankwest Online Banking (BOB) and the Bankwest App.

Enjoy secure Online Business Banking at your fingertips. As a customer on this account you may also be entitled to apply for our Online Business Banking service. If you apply for that service you will be provided with a separate Product Disclosure Statement and your use of the service will be a matter of separate agreement with us. Separate fees are applicable for this service (but are limited to Recall and Record fees).
Over the counter transactions available at Bankwest branches.
You can bank over the phone.
View your account statements online at any time with eStatements.
The option to track your finances through data feeds to accounting software packages like Xero(TM) and MYOB(R).
Other fees which the Bank charges for its services, including services not specific to this account but for which you may be charged are listed in our Bankwest Your Guide to Banking Fees brochure.
You can set up ongoing payments for things like bills or loan repayments.

The Sweep Facility operates as an automatic periodic transfer of funds only between nominated Bankwest accounts held with us in the same name(s) and capacity(ies). It is governed by the terms of the Sweep Facility authority you give to us.
Offers an optional overdraft facility, subject to lending approval and criteria. Fees will apply.

constraints.additionalInfo: No minimum deposit required to open the account.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Your business type is a sole trader, partnership, company, trust, super fund (including self managed super fund), society, strata or cooperative.
The business was established and has tax residency in Australia.
Only available to relationship managed customers.

fees.name: Overseas ATM Fee
fees.additionalInfo: No Bankwest-charged overseas ATM access fees. The overseas bank may charge a fee for using their ATM.

fees.name: Manual Credit Transfer Fee
fees.additionalInfo: A credit transfer of funds to a non-Bankwest branded account within Australia (excluding International Transfers and Real Time Gross Settlement), performed in a Bankwest Store. Each such credit transfer will incur a $5.00 fee. A credit transfer of funds can be performed manually upon receipt of instructions via letter, e-mail or facsimile (fax) will incur a $10.00 fee per transfer.

fees.name: Salary Schedue Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Transfer fee per schedule. Fees for individual pay transaction to Bankwest-branded accounts of $1.00 and individual pay transaction to non-Bankwest-branded account of $10.00 per payment.

fees.name: Line Of Credit Fee
fees.additionalInfo: A Line of Credit Fee applies if (1) the account has an authorised credit limit that has been quoted for 10 or more days during the fee raising period, whether the account is in debit or credit, or (2) the account is overdrawn during the fee raising period by (a) $1,000 or more, or (b) for 10 days or more including non-business days, whether or not consecutive, by any amount, and whether (a) or (b) applies, Bankwest elects to honour (pay) the transaction which overdraws the account. The fee raising period is quarterly and the fee is debited to the account in arrears on the last business day of March, June, September and December or when the account is closed or limit is cancelled. The fee is $0 when the greater of the authorised credit limit or overdrawn balance is $500.99 or less, or a minimum $50 or 0.3% of the max credit limit or overdrawn balance when the greater of the authorised credit limit or overdrawn balance is $501 and over.

fees.name: Overdrawn Notice Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Overdrawn Notice Fee. This fee applies when your account is overdrawn without prior authorisation (ie there are insufficient funds or an authorised credit limit is exceeded), Bankwest elects to honour (pay) the transaction which overdraws your account and issues you with an Overdrawn Notice. Each Overdrawn Notice issued will incur a $45.00 fee.

fees.name: Honour Fee
fees.additionalInfo: A $10.00 Honour Fee will apply when one or more transactions overdraw the account, Bankwest elects to honour (pay) the transaction(s), and Bankwest does not issue an Overdrawn Notice. A transaction will be taken to overdraw your account if it causes the balance to exceed the funds available in your account.

fees.name: Outward Dishonour Fee
fees.additionalInfo: A $10.00 Outward Dishonour Fee will be charged to the account where there are insufficient cleared funds in your account to cover a cheque drawn on your account or an authorised debit request made in respect of your account.

fees.name: Inward Dishonour Fee
fees.additionalInfo: A $10.00 Inward Dishonour Fee will be charged to the account where you deposit a cheque into your account which is not honoured by the financial institution on which the cheque is drawn.

fees.name: Search Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Fees will apply although no fee will exceed the fee shown. These Search Fees are listed in our Bankwest Your Guide to Banking Fees brochure.

fees.name: Cheque Stop Payment
fees.additionalInfo: Fee to stop payment on an issued cheque. This fee is $25 when payment is stopped on a range of cheques.

fees.name: Inward Payment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: We will charge a fee of $10.00 per transaction for each deposit via the Real Time Gross Settlement System and SWIFT Network.

fees.name: Duplicate Statement Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Customers requesting a duplicate paper statement to be printed (including faxes) will be charged a duplicate statement fee of $2.50 per statement.

fees.name: Foreign Transaction Fee
fees.additionalInfo: We will charge a fee equal to 2.95% of the transaction amount for each transaction occurring outside Australia (whether in foreign currency or Australian dollars) posted to your account.

lendingRates.additionalInfo: If an approved overdraft is held on the account, the applicable interest rate is the sum of the Bank's Bankwest Business Market Reference Rate plus a margin dependent on the security offered. Interest is debited to the account on the last business day of each month.

If the debit balance of the account exceeds the available balance, or if the account is overdrawn without prior arrangement, debit interest will be charged at the rate being the aggregate of the Bank's Bankwest Business Market Reference Rate plus 4.50% p.a. Interest is debited to the account on the last business day of each month.

data.name: Business Zero Transaction Account
data.description: An account for managing everyday business transactions. It's available to sole traders, partnerships, companies, trusts, super funds (including SMSFs), societies, strata and cooperatives that were established and have tax residency in Australia.
